p: Baricitinib is a small, orally active molecule that inhibits Janus kinase 1 and2. The Janus kinase family, including JAK1, JAK2, JAK3, and tyrosine kinase 2 (Tyk2), has important roles in some signaling pathways through its triggering of the cytokine-induced phosphorylation of STAT that is later transported to the nucleus to regulate gene transcription [ 64, 65].
